bug.author: sadovnychyi
bug.summary: doc.text doesn't match the original provided
bug.description:
import spacy nlp = spacy.load('en_core_web_sm') text = 'whereve' print(nlp('whereve').text) assert nlp('whereve').text == text <denchmark-code>where've Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> AssertionError </denchmark-code>
Seems to be a bug, since I'm expecting the documents to match exactly to retrieve the metadata for each of them after they are parsed. Happens with both en_core_web_sm@1.2.0 and en_core_web_md@1.2.1. <denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 1.8.2 Platform: Darwin-16.6.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.6.1 Installed models: en_core_web_md, en_core_web_sm, en_depent_web_md

comments.comment: Thanks! This will be a problem somewhere in the TOKENIZER_EXCEPTIONS. You can patch this at run-time to workaround the issue until we get it fixed in the next release.
Thanks â€“ this was indeed a typo, damn. Just fixed it!
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
